title: Caitlin's traps are too strong.
body:
Usually I make a long post, justifying all the reasons why I think X champ is too strong etc.

Not this time.
Because you all know _exactly_  what I'm talking about.

Time for action boys!

replies.body: Yeah perhaps reduce the amount that bitch can lay down too. 5 is too many imo.

Ye, I don't have a particular problem with the traps themselves but, when you get walled in by 5 of them such that it's near impossible to not hit one it is....painful. I feel either a reduced snare duration (maybe lowered arm time to compensate?) or a limit of 4 would be nice without gutting the ability.

That said, while reliable, Caitlyn is hardly a champ I'd call OP. The traps are really only too strong if you have a team comp to back it up :P

I think it could be interesting to have the traps unable to arm themselves if they are within X units of an enemy champion.

That way she could use them for actually setting pre-meditated a trap, rather than just using them as a slightly delayed in-battle snare.
It would also mean she could still zone you, but only if she pre-planned it, and not just wall you off when you're right there.

Im not sure, I'm not a caitlin player, so i don't know how much that would damage her.
Just a thought.

But with a 20%+ pick rate, and one of the higher winrates, she's obviously doing something a lot better than other champs.

I think such a thing would be a bit much, it removes a lot of the play making power Caitlyn has, and she already doesn't have that much given her kit and range.

Her pick rate is likely so high because she's one of the most reliable ADCs. It's hard to get behind even with basica competency, and pretty hard to snowball against her since she's so safe, especially if she has a decent support. She also has good synergy with pretty much any champion.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=O375aN2d,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-18T10:54:47.509+0000)
>
It's hard to get behind even with basica competency, and pretty hard to snowball against her since she's so safe, especially if she has a decent support. She also has good synergy with pretty much any champion.

All the more reason to reduce some of her power.

Youre probably right though, I agree that my suggestion probably was too much, but it cant be _too_ far from the mark.

As it stands, her support's entire job is to hold the enemy still for 1.1 seconds, as long as they can do that, she can just pop a trap under the enemy, stopping them from reaching her for another 2 seconds. When they finally get out of that, she just throws a net towards them, leaping to safety as well as slowing them, giving herself even more time to deliver the final headshot. Thats like a free 4 second window for her to kill them.

Any ADC even half worth their salt can kill just about anything in 4 seconds. 
Hell, im probably the shittest ADC out there, on top of that, Kalista is my main bot laner, and even I could kill something given that window.

Something needs to go on her, either its her range, her headshot damage, the death-sentence traps, or her easy escape.
Having some of that is fine and makes her who she is, but all of it is a little much.

In my opinion of course.

Let's be honest, the balance in this game is never going to be perfect. Overwatch only has a roster of 24 heroes and even that game will never find perfect balance. These kinda games are constantly evolving, and I think there are higher balance priorities than Caitlyn atm, especially when there are still plenty of assassins that can shut her down pretty hard :P

My point though, was that reliability (which can heavily influence pick rate) doesn't necessarily mean a champ is too strong. Remember that all of us are speaking from limited perspective, and I can't help but notice that most of us here in this thread are no higher than gold (at least not on the accounts they are posting with), so our perspective is limited.

___
As for balance more generally:
http://www.gdcvault.com/play/1024237/Balancing-League-of-Legends-for

This was a real interesting video to watch (real glad there was a x1.25 option though) from Ghostcrawler about game balance. Most of it is a general developer spiel in the sense that he is using League as his example to draw broader conclusions, but he talks specifically about why League balances the same at all levels of play (i.e where there aren't different patches for low elo, high elo and pro) among other things.

He also talks about some other contested topics like why Riot doesn't give visible data and why they tend to overpatch rather than underpatch to tune more finely (nerf fatigue and time constraints).

He also mentions a rather sad example in your beloved Azir, something he refers to as basementing where they basically nerf a champion out of the game until they can spend adequate time to properly fix their problems :(

All in all it's a good insight onto how Riot balances, and why they do what they do. A lot of people seem to think that balance changes are made out of spite, or at the very least a lack of insight, bu there's a lot more to it than that.

Oh, of course it can never be perfect :P
But if the balance of the game needs to be a game of whack-a-mole, then lets at least whack the moles when they do pop up. xD

And you're definitely right, there are champs that need far more attention than cait!

Thanks for the link to that video btw, i haven't watched it all yet, but its pretty insightful.

Yea haha feels bad for Azir xD. But tbh I like him underpowered, those who love him can still have a +50% winrate on him 
and it means he isn't the go to pick for every man and his dog when they want to win, like Zed and Hecarim.

And in my opinion, nerfing them out of the game is much better than leaving them in there to cause problems. 
Its better to disadvantage Azir players and nerf him, rather than disadvantage all mid laners by leaving him as a monster.

Yea i know theres a huge amount of thought that goes into patches, and none of it is done out of spite.

It's hard to deny their logic once you actually understand it ey. Having it all laid out in a nice little presentation certainly doesn't hurt. I'm glad I got bored enough to give it a listen :P Really offers some great perspective.

While most is sound, some of their logic I can deny.
For example they are happy to nerf Azir out of the game, but i bet they wouldn't dare do it to Yasuo/Zed/Lee Sin.

Considering how many people play them, its fair enough from a business standpoint to keep them in the spotlight, but it is suspect from an ethical standpoint, having different logic for different champs and balance issues. And those 3 and a few others essentially hold riot hostage through their popularity.

Yea i watched a good deal of it, and i definitely will go back and watch more, its really insightful! xD
I mean it just makes her already strong siege ability that much stronger. Something definately should be done about it. There is nothing else i would change though at her current state.
Can't disagree :)

The traps are very good zoning tools with very little counterplay. I mean, why not make them like all traps and let minions set them off as well? Or even better, give the trap hit points so we can destroy the damn things

Youre right.

All other zoning tools in the game have drawbacks.
Heim's turrets have HP and can be destroyed.
Azir's soldiers time-out
Zyras plants have both of the above.
Orianna's ball can only be in 1 place at a time. 
Illaoi's tentacles can be dodged and destroyed.
Ditto with GP's barrels.
Nidalee's traps are set off by minions.
etc etc.

Cait's traps have almost no counterplay compared to everyone else.
maybe don't step on them lol?
Until the level 7 cait main has mastered placing her traps right behind you as you turn to run back

The amount of times I have been avoiding them _(being hit by her Q the whole time of course, because theres no room to avoid it without stepping on a trap)_, and then when I click to move, the random as fuck pathing around minions slaps my champ smack bang on a trap....

Not to mention its hard to to avoid them mid teamfight when she puts one on you, and its 99% hidden by the huge Darius forcing himself upon you,  then randomly _(from your perspective)_ you stop moving and get 1 hit by her.

> [{quoted}](name=CHEESYLEEKS,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=O375aN2d,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-03-15T13:21:31.851+0000)
>
> maybe don't step on them lol?

that fact you can hide them due to the bad camera angles of the game makes it bad, you can put them under minions so they arm before you see them too. so sometimes its ahrd to spot

yeah i agree that caits traps are too strong, but not because of the damage, but more because of the risk or the damage other than the trap itself. the headshot, plus whatever cc the enemy team has. but the traps are too oppressive early, i feel if they toned down the damage early. but then again, i would rather they make them like the old traps

You are all commenting as though you dont play a few favorite champs with one or more op skills that have little to no outplay themselves. Cait is Cait and you know this from the start of the game. It cant come as a surprise that you may get caught in a trap, and its not like you'r getting 100-0d in half a second like you can with some other champs.

> [{quoted}](name=Waysted1,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=O375aN2d,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-03-17T06:34:09.950+0000)
>
> Cait is Cait and you know this from the start of the game. It cant come as a surprise that you may get caught in a trap,

And Zed is Zed, and Hec is Hec. Just because you're expecting to be raped, doesn't make rape ok.

______

You say "why complain, when your own champs have little or no outplay" 

Well my favourite champs are Azir, Aurelion Sol, and Taliyah, and when I play ADC I play Kalista.

So yea.... they all have such little counterplay and I have no right to talk about Caitlin, when I play such dick-move champions.

Even if you add them all together, their pick rates combined don't even reach 1/4 of Caitlin's pick rate. So theres something clearly different that Caitlin is doing, and somehow I don't think its just because she's "more interesting as a champion".
